titleproper.value: Guide to the Thomas William Edmondson Papers <num>MC.17</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Barbara J. Balliet, January 1978.  Electronic version prepared by Ashley Sena-Levine.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-06-13T15:41:27</date>

extent.value: in 2 manuscript boxes and on half-manuscript box

abstract.value: Thomas William Edmondson was a professor of mathematics at New York University (NYU) and served the University as Secretary of the Executive Committee of the University Council (1900-1902), Secretary of the Faculty Committee of the University Council (1903-1933), acting dean of the Graduate School (1916-1921), and Chairman of the Washington Square Collegiate Division (1913). This collection consists of his correspondence with family and friends.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Thomas William Edmondson Papers; MC 17; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Thomas W. Edmondson was married in 1896 to Minnie Ramsden.  They had no children.

Thomas William Edmondson, married to Minnie Ramsden in 1896.
          No children.

subject.value: Physics -- Study and teaching -- United States
Mathematics --  Study and teaching -- United States

corpname.value: New York University. Graduate School of Arts and Science
